Approaches the mother of love,</br>The month of unsullied delight;</br>Her hand is adorn'd with a dove,</br>Her head is emblossom'd with white.</br>With colours that glow on the view</br>The pencil of Flora is behold,</br>Her garment of sky-brighten'd blue</br>Has studded with silver and gold.

The novel of nature we read,</br>How pleasing her prospects expand,</br>Thro' woodland, inclosure, and mead,</br>New beauties emerge from the land.</br>The carols of spring from the grove</br>Re-echo melodious notes,</br>'Tis the innocent music of love,</br>On the bosom of aether that floats.

Come, Pales, if pastoral lay</br>Your fancy to transport has led;</br>Panegyrics I sing on the May,</br>Assist me the portrait to spread.</br>And Pan with thy musical reed,</br>Sylvanus, thy neighbour, invite;</br>The muse in her progress to spread,</br>Protect her unpolish'd delight.

'Tis Pales herself on the plain,</br>Her robe of the dew-freshen'd green;</br>She can't be averse my strain,</br>So mild and compos'd is her mien.</br>Ye shepherds, your fleece-coated charge,</br>Her mandate permits to release,</br>Young bleaters go ramble at large,</br>Unfolded, go wander in peace.

The maple and plane-tree in bloom</br>Emblazon each sylvan retreat;</br>And Flora purloin from thy loom</br>To canopy over each seat.</br>By the side of the park in the vale</br>The hawthorn, young minion of May,</br>Her bosom unfolds to the gale</br>In blossoms exub'rant and gay.

The pink, many varied of vest,</br>The yellow and white asphodel,</br>And tulip, in pageantry dress'd,</br>Are emulous each to excel.</br>The rose, royal empress of sweets,</br>In the path of the fashion'd parterre,</br>The suckle and jessamine greets,</br>Sweet blossom her reign to revere.

Deep sunk in the lap of the dale,</br>Of Elegance simple the queen,</br>To lavish her sweets on the gale,</br>The lilly dawn-bosom'd is seen.</br>The orchis and fox-glove appear,</br>The hare-bell's alive in the shade,</br>Purple goddess that paints the young year,</br>Thy pallet each landscape is made.

Come, Delia, dear Hebe of youth,</br>O come, with thy dark azure eye;</br>How sweet to my heart is thy truth!</br>To the arms of thy Corydon fly.</br>See May, from yon rose-shedding cloud,</br>Restoress of pleasure descends;</br>The zephys await on the crowd</br>Of Sports which her levee attends.

Of Sol, the bright daughter, each hour</br>As devious we wander along,</br>Shall smile like a beam on the shower,</br>And Philomel heighten her song.</br>With innocence fix'd for our guide,</br>Thou sweeter by far than the May,</br>Tranquility close by our side,</br>Let Flora her rival survey.

The prais'd renovation enjoy,</br>My fair, with serenity bless'd,</br>And let not one trouble annoy</br>The halcyon May of thy breast.</br>May pleasure that's virtuous and pure,</br>Your heart true felicity bring,</br>Thro' a series of time to insure</br>In your mind a perpetual spring.

What month in the mutable year</br>For honours with May can compare?</br>The virtues of nature appear</br>Mild, innocent, noble and fair.</br>For see, 'mid the gay-purpled scenes,</br>Which scatter their fragrance on May,</br>They reign with the greatest of queens,</br>Of birth, whose imperial day

Returns, and loud Paean's arise,</br>The shouts of Britannia's acclaim,</br>Universally mount to the skies,</br>So great and deserv'd is her fame.</br>Bright pattern of conjugal love,</br>The blessings of truth are thy own,</br>The graces, new-born from above,</br>Are gems which embellish thy throne.

To soften the pillow of state,</br>Forbid the approach of a frown,</br>Dispel all the cares which await</br>On the pomp that encircles a crown.</br>O spare her, ye years, as you glide,</br>My muse of warm loyalty sings:</br>May Charlotte, of Albion the pride,</br>Long reign with the happiest of kings.

'Tis nature's spontaneous smile,</br>With gladness the earth is elate,</br>One carpet of velvet the soil</br>Has spread in superlative state.</br>The plume-painted minstrels of song</br>Commingle their generous lays</br>In notes which to raptures prolong</br>The season's creator they praise.

Shall man be deficient in grace?</br>Let gratitude banish the thought!</br>The hand of divinity trace</br>In May with munificence fraught.</br>The muse, admiration's thy friend,</br>Shall join in the mental repast,</br>The knee of thanksgiving to bend,</br>For mercies both present and past.</br>
